root: ^And once again you’re listening to the program ‘Young Radio Technician’. We’re on the air every morning and evening, every day.
^We’re continuing our lecture course on radio.
^This time we’ll tell you that to catch the signal you need, you can not only change the frequency, but also try switching antennas. Most likely you’ve got a couple of old antennas lying around.
^You can even use antennas from alien costumes — who knows, maybe you’ll catch an extraterrestrial broadcast, ha-ha!
^Tomorrow we’ll be back with more interesting tips.
